2. The presence of residual melanoma and changes at the previous biopsy site suggests that the tumor is advanced and may have already spread.
3. The fact that four out of eleven lymph nodes tested positive for melanoma indicates that the tumor has metastasized to the lymph nodes.

Based on these findings, it is likely that the patient will not survive for 1.43 years. The tumor has already spread to the lymph nodes and has broken through the lymph node capsule, indicating a high risk of further progression and potential distant metastasis.
